definition: without missing a word
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
(negative prefix)/not/no
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: I repeated them until I could recite seventy stories without dropping a word.
sentences.chinese: 我反覆背誦，直到我能一字不漏地背出七十篇故事來。

sentences.english: She listened attentively and set down every word he said.
sentences.chinese: 她專心聽着，把他說的話一字不漏地記下來。

sentences.english: Dutifully his troops began to craft a solution.
sentences.chinese: 一字不漏地他的軍隊開始工藝解決這一問題。

sentences.english: He wrote down every word the teacher said.
sentences.chinese: 他把老師講的一字不漏地記下來。

sentences.english: She learned the poem many years ago, but she recited it word for word.
sentences.chinese: 她是許多年前學的這首詩，但仍能一字不漏地背出來。

sentences.english: Repeated word for word of what she said to me.
sentences.chinese: 他把談話的內容一字不漏地複述出來。

sentences.english: She listened carefully and set down every word he said.
sentences.chinese: 她專心聽着，把他說的話一字不漏的記下來。

sentences.english: The children were following every word of the stroy intently .
sentences.chinese: 孩子們一字不漏地專心聽故事。

sentences.english: The reporters copied down every word spoken by the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 記者一字不漏地記下首相說的話。

sentences.english: He could recite the prose chapter and verse.
sentences.chinese: 他能一字不漏地背誦那篇散文。

sentences.english: She was conscientious and eager and, without missing a word, took down what was said.
sentences.chinese: 她認真熱情，一字不漏地記下了所說的話。

sentences.english: Conscientious and eager, she took down what was said, careful not to miss a word.
sentences.chinese: 她認真熱情，一字不漏地記下了所說的話。

sentences.english: The president gave a letter-perfect speech.
sentences.chinese: 總統演講時把講稿一字不漏地念出來。

sentences.english: DO NOT try to write down every word.
sentences.chinese: 不要想一字不漏地記筆記。

sentences.english: He copied the letters carefully and accurately.
sentences.chinese: 他仔細地一字不漏地抄寫這些信件。

definition: see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
word for word/verbatim
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
to pass on (stories)/to relate
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
to be very clear about sth (idiom)
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to hear clearly
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to eavesdrop/to monitor (secretly)
